page.description: An essential decision about a link control is what it will display. The options are: Value in field, Value from other field(s), Static text, Static image, Image in another control

discussion.p: Link controls have choices for the Link address type. The link could be: a URL (presumably also a field value), an email address (presumably also a field value), a link to the detail view form, a value that is computed (see Link Address Builder ), a value that specifies filter, order, and/or linking information for the records in a second grid

section.title: In-line style
section.description: Specifies style attributes that override the settings inherited from the style sheet. Click to define the In-line style. Refer to the Style Editor for details.

section.title: Display what in link?
section.description: Specifies style attributes that override the settings inherited from the style sheet. Click to define the In-line style. Refer to the Style Editor for details. Specifies what is displayed in the link. The options are:"Value in field", "Value from other field(s)", "Static text", "Static image", "Image in another control"

section.title: Field(s) to display
section.description: Specify the HTML to display in the link. Use field placeholders to include values from other fields in the Grid. Typically, the fields that you reference will have their 'Hide row' or 'Hide column' property checked.

section.title: Static text
section.description: Specify the text to display in the link.
section.tip: You can include HTML markup in the text.

section.title: Static image
section.description: Specify the name of the image to display.

section.title: Static image inline style
section.description: Specify style attributes for the image.

section.title: Static image text
section.description: Specify the text description for the image. Tip: To display the contents of a text field, enclose the field in curly braces. e.g. {description}

section.title: Dynamic image control
section.description: Specify the image control on the Grid that contains the image to display in the link. Typically, the 'Hide row' or 'Hide column' property for this control will be checked.

step.description: Open the Grid Builder . On the Design tab click on the Component Type page and select Tabular in the Grid Layout menu.
Open the Data Source page and select either .dbf or SQL .
On the Query(DBF) or Query(AlphaDAO) page select the table you will work from.
Open the Fields page. Select several fields and move them from the Available Fields: list into the Selected: fields list; using the arrows between the two list.
Select the field that you want to contain the linking data.
Go to the selected field's Field Properties list. Under the Display Settings section find the Control type property. Set the control type to 'link '.
Now go to the Link Properties section of the Field Properties. Find the Display what in link? property and select "Image in another control ".
While in Link Properties set the Dynamic image control property to the name of the image field you wish to display. For the Link address type property select "DetailView link ".

section.title: Static Text
section.description: You use the Link Display Value dialog box to compose the HTML code that will be displayed in a link. The link may contain references to any of the fields on the grid.

step.description: Select the field placeholders in the Available Fields list that you want to use in the link expression.
Arrange the field placeholders in the order that you want to see them in the expression.
Optionally, add any text that you want around the fields.
Optionally, click HTML Editor to use it to format the expression.
Click OK to save your work or Cancel to discard it.

section.description: You can specify that the link address type is 'Javascript'. Any Javascript function call or command can be added to the 'onClick' event. section.title: Target frame or window
section.description: The default is "Explicit". Defines where to display the linked page. The default is Null. The options are: Blank (opens in a new window) "Explicit", "WindowName" (e.g. "Window2"), "_blank", "_parent", "_self", "_search", "_top"

case.description: Clear Parameters - The default is .F. . Specifies whether the target URL preserves existing parameters.
Scroll to Detail View - The default is .T. . Specifies that the page should scroll down to display the detail view form when a record is selected.
